title: First lvl 6 mastery token disappeared?
body: so i got one lvl 6 riven mastery token right before my 2 week suspension and just today i got another one but the first one disappeared. now if this is riots way of saying fuck you then i do not approve because i did earn that token and regardless of if i got punished the same day i got it, i still got it and to say that all my previous work and effort to gain that first token was null and void because of a 2 week suspension brings me beyond disbelief. yeah i get riot owns all its content but i just dont think its fair to me at all. dont comment saying "you got what you deserved" or any comment just to laugh because thats technically harassment. only constructive input is wanted or needed.

replies.body:
Mastery Tokens currently drop regardless of behavioral infractions, so a suspension won't stop you from receiving tokens.  Looking into this for you, I saw that your previous S games with Riven were around May 21st.  During this time, there was a widespread issue where tokens were not dropping, and we had a support ticker on this available [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/208872326--May-20-We-re-aware-of-an-issue-that-occasionally-prevents-mastery-token-drops-We-re-aiming-to-resolve-this-in-patch-6-11):

> [MAY 20] WE'RE AWARE OF AN ISSUE THAT OCCASIONALLY PREVENTS MASTERY TOKEN DROPS. WE'RE AIMING TO RESOLVE THIS IN PATCH 6.11

Looking further into this, I don't see any previous history of the account having a token beyond the 1 you currently have.  It would be necessary to play another game and earn an S to receive the last necessary token.

We'd be happy to provide more specific information if you'd, just hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) for that.  Otherwise, I hope that helps clear things up, and good luck!
right after i got the s token i was suspended. im sure if i send in a support ticket i will only receive a copy paste response, but per your orders i will.
The suggestion for a ticket was only if you needed more specifics, like dates or timelines.  The context would be the same!
your support team has yet to respond
